item.title: Swine flu
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

[quote=“Slave Scyth, post:54, topic:277220”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=365882.msg3004942#msg3004942 date=1256323838]

The average flu takes the lives of 35,000 to 40,000 individuals a year in the United States of America. This ‘swine flu’ has only take the life of one individual in the United States of America. Aren’t we overreacting a bit?

Actually I know of 2 people here in ohio where I live that have died from it already, one was a pregnant woman and another was a kid in kindergarten. So your fact is obviously wrong.
[/quote]Hey, Ohio bud.

I actually recently had swine flu. What a media ripoff; didn’t throw up once, temp maxed at 102. Definitely shows how much the media can blow something up just to scare the crap out of everyone in the country.

My friend’s sister actually has it as well, in the same city as the girl who died in kindergarten.[/quote]

Hello Scyth i have had it also, all i have been doing is sneezing, coughing, and my eyes and joints were hurting, my temperature was 101 and i was on a lot of Tylenol but i never had to vomit either.

Read full topic

The average flu takes the lives of 35,000 to 40,000 individuals a year in the United States of America. This ‘swine flu’ has only take the life of one individual in the United States of America. Aren’t we overreacting a bit?
[/quote]

Actually I know of 2 people here in ohio where I live that have died from it already, one was a pregnant woman and another was a kid in kindergarten. So your fact is obviously wrong.[/quote]Hey, Ohio bud.

I actually recently had swine flu. What a media ripoff; didn’t throw up once, temp maxed at 102. Definitely shows how much the media can blow something up just to scare the crap out of everyone in the country.

My friend’s sister actually has it as well, in the same city as the girl who died in kindergarten.

Read full topic

item.title: Swine flu
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Taharok, post:47, topic:277220”][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=365882.msg3006601#msg3006601 date=1256450230]
I don’t see what the big deal is. If you have flu like symptoms get it checked out. If it’s the flu, woopty fucking doo, deal with it like you normally would. If it’s swine flu, woopty fucking doo, deal with it the same way. Pop a couple bendaryl, drink half a bottle of nyquil, and sleep for 18 hours. YOu’ll be perfectly fine when you wake up;
[/quote]

You forgot about the 2-3 weeks of coughing that comes afterward. Even when the virus is no longer contagious, the coughing continues. Isn’t that pleasant. :rolleyes:[/quote]

Vicks and anti inflamatorys. And maybe steroids if you really need them, All of which can be picked up at any pharmacy.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:2, topic:277220”]Actually I’m hoping it goes around in my school, as it’d be closed down.[/quote]No you don’t. Whatever you miss you have to make up for it in the summer. And from what I’ve heard, it takes ~4 weeks to completely rid the virus or traces of the virus within a vicinity.
